thread.title: Jason Garrett reversal: Greg Hardy's outburst, slapping coach's clipboard not 'right time and place'
thread.title_full: Jason Garrett reversal: Greg Hardy's outburst, slapping coach's clipboard not 'right time and place' | Dallas Morning News

author: SportsDayDFW.com
title: Jason Garrett reversal: Greg Hardy's outburst, slapping coach's clipboard not 'right time and place'
text:
Jason Garrett reversed himself on Monday, saying Greg Hardy's sideline outburst during Sunday's game was not "the right time and place."
The comments came on Garrett's radio appearance on 105.3 The Fan's Shan and RJ.
After former Cowboys receiver Dwayne Harris returned a kickoff 100 yards for a touchdown, Hardy attempted to motivate his teammates, but it developed into a shoving match near the sideline between him, special teams coordinator Rich Bisaccia and players at a critical point in the game.
Hardy was seen slapping a clipboard out of Bisaccia's hands on video.
Multiple Cowboys defensive linemen and receiver Dez Bryant, who was not in uniform, talked to Hardy on the sideline in an effort to get him under control.
On Sunday, owner Jerry Jones, coach Jason Garrett, Bisaccia and several players defended Hardy's action by saying the defensive end was only trying to motivate his teammates.
Said Garrett: "I don't think that's an issue at all. When that happens, you encourage guys, you get guys excited, you try to get guys ready for the next challenge. I believe from my vantage point that's what he was doing. You have to have passion."
On Monday, Garrett tried to explain things in more detail.
"That was just a situation that oftentimes happens on a sideline where guys are trying to encourage and inspire other guys on their team. He was fired up and wanted to make sure that the special teams unit was going to get the job done. Sometimes those things happen.
"It wasn't exactly the right time and place as we're getting ready to go out on the field. We got that conveyed and communicated and we all moved on."
See the video and get more details about the incident here:
Did Greg Hardy go too far in his sideline outburst Sunday?
